author: protolambda
content:
Validators who don't update their node will stay attesting and producing blocks, but spin off in their own fork. Assuming they are a minority and stay in consensus with other non-updated validators, you get two chains:
- The legacy chain, which will not perform well with just a minority of validators online, and an inactivity-leak kicks in, causing the online validators to not earn the common rewards, and all updated validators will appear as inactive and get penalized at an accelerated rate. It will leak out all offline validators (a lot!), and eventually stabilize. When it manages to leak out that many validators, it can technically finalize again, and continue to exist. But if we're talking about a 5% fork, it will likely be very chaotic on this chain.
- The upgraded chain, where all updated validators will operate like normal. The inactive minority will appear as inactive, but if there are not many, the chain will keep finalizing, and the accelerated inactivity leak will likely not kick in. The non-updated validators will get penalized just as if they were offline. The non-updated validators can safely update, and then their node will reorganize to join the canonical chain.
